entities.name: OLYMPIC GAMES
entities.description: One of the most prestigious and celebrated sporting events in the world, with a history dating back to ancient Greece, held in honor of the Greek god Zeus, and revived in the late 19th century by Pierre de Coubertin

entities.name: OLYMPIA
entities.description: Ancient city in Greece where the Olympic Games were first held in 776 BC

entities.name: GREECE
entities.description: Country where the ancient and modern Olympic Games have been held, including the first modern Games in Athens in 1896

entities.name: ZEUS
entities.description: Greek god for whom the ancient Olympic Games were held as a religious festival

entities.name: THEODOSIUS
entities.description: Roman Emperor who abolished the ancient Olympic Games in 393 AD, deeming them incompatible with Christianity

entities.name: PIERRE DE COUBERTIN
entities.description: French educator who founded the modern Olympic Games in 1894, inspired by the ancient Olympics and believing in the power of sport to promote peace and understanding

entities.name: ATHENS
entities.description: City in Greece where the first modern Olympic Games were held in 1896

entities.name: BERLIN
entities.description: City in Germany where the 1936 Olympics were held, used as a propaganda tool by Nazi Germany

entities.name: MOSCOW
entities.description: City in the Soviet Union where the 1980 Olympics were held, boycotted by several Western countries in protest of the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan

entities.name: SOVIET UNION
entities.description: Country that hosted the 1980 Moscow Olympics and was involved in a political dispute leading to a boycott by several Western countries

entities.name: WESTERN COUNTRIES
entities.description: Group of countries that boycotted the 1980 Moscow Olympics in protest of the Soviet Union's invasion of Afghanistan

entities.name: AFGHANISTAN
entities.description: Country invaded by the Soviet Union, leading to the boycott of the 1980 Moscow Olympics by several Western countries

relations: The Olympic Games originated in Olympia, where they were held in honor of Zeus
The Olympic Games have strong ties to Greece, both in ancient and modern times
The Olympic Games were originally held as a religious festival in honor of Zeus
The Olympic Games were abolished by Theodosius in 393 AD
Pierre de Coubertin founded the modern Olympic Games in 1894
The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens in 1896
The 1936 Berlin Olympics were used as a propaganda tool by Nazi Germany
The 1980 Moscow Olympics were boycotted by several Western countries
Nazi Germany used the 1936 Berlin Olympics as a propaganda tool
The Soviet Union hosted the 1980 Moscow Olympics
Several Western countries boycotted the 1980 Moscow Olympics in protest of the Soviet Union's actions
The Soviet Union's invasion of Afghanistan led to the boycott of the 1980 Moscow Olympics
The Soviet Union's invasion of Afghanistan led to a boycott of the 1980 Moscow Olympics by several Western countries
The Soviet Union invaded Afghanistan, leading to international political disputes
